edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.proj1
Class FileManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.proj1.FileManager

public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class manages all of the file reading and writing operations. It's a little quick and dirty (unmodular) but it does a great job of abstracting the processes from the callers

Author:
Satshabad

Method Detail

getMoviesFromFile

public Movie[] getMoviesFromFile()
This method reads from the standard list of movies (res\movies.txt) inflated the Movie Objects.

Returns:
an array of Movie objects from the file res\movies.txt

addMovietoFile

public void addMovietoFile(Movie m)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Deprecated. not needed for project req.

This method lets the caller add a Movie object to the standard list of movies for use from now on. The Movie is broken into components and written to the file res\movies.txt

Parameters:
m - the movie to be added
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file movies.txt can not be found

saveWaitingQueue

public void saveWaitingQueue(PriorityQueue<Movie> p)
                      throws java.io.IOException
This method saves the state of the PriorityQueue object passed and all of it's contained objects.

Parameters:
p - the PriorityQueue in the state to be saved
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be made

getSavedWaitingQueue

public PriorityQueue<Movie> getSavedWaitingQueue()
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This returns the last saved state of the PriorityQueue passed. If there is no last saved state nullis returned

Returns:
the last saved queue or null if there is no last saved queue
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file can not be made or found
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the file can not be found

saveHomeQueue

public void saveHomeQueue(MyQueue<Movie> p)
                   throws java.io.IOException
This method saves the state of the MyQueue object passed and all of it's contained objects.

Parameters:
p - the MyQueue in the state to be saved
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when the file can not be made

getSavedHomeQueue

public MyQueue<Movie> getSavedHomeQueue()
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This returns the last saved state of the MyQueue passed. If there is no last saved state nullis returned

Returns:
the last saved queue or null if there is no last saved queue
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when the file can not be found
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - when the file can not be made

fileWrite

private <E> void fileWrite(java.lang.String fileName,
                           E p)
                throws java.io.IOException
This internal method handles the writing to the passed file.

Parameters:
fileName - the name and path of the file to be written to
p - the object to be written out
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when the file can not be made
